item.title: “Let That Sink In. Your Time and Life is Much More Valuable Than You think."
item.description: “Let That Sink In. Your Time and Life is Much More Valuable Than You think." Warren Buffet is worth over 100 billion dollars Yet, nobody in this room would want to trade places with him If we aren’t willing to trade places with one of the richest people in the world, what does this say?

item.title: Making Money Doesn't Have to Be Evil
item.description: Making Money Doesn’t Have to Be Evil Twitter conditions to think that it has to be evil, but these are misconceptions.

item.title: Normalize Living with Your Parents
item.description: Normalize Living with Your Parents You can save a lot by reducing housing costs.

item.title: You Can Live Off So Little
item.description: You Can Live Off So Little You really learn this when [[Study Abroad|Living Abroad]]. In Ukraine, Tiago was able to live off $250 a month.

item.title: MIT Orientation Story (You Belong Here)
item.description: MIT Orientation Story (You Belong Here) In the freshman orientation at MIT, the presenter asked the incoming class to raise their hands if they were sure they belonged there, that MIT had done the right thing to accept them into this impressive university.

item.title: Easterlin Paradox
item.description: Easterlin Paradox What makes the paradox a paradox is that happiness is related to income at a time (in the cross-section) but not over time (in the time series).

item.title: Dumb Kid in a Hotel
item.description: Dumb Kid in a Hotel A man sitting in the hotel said to his friend “Look at that kid waiting tables, he’s so dumb that if I put 500 and 50 notes in front of him, he will pick up the fifty note….
